Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list:
This lesson is about how to keep Your Child safe online. 📱

There is so much to share. We will cover online safety over two lessons.2️⃣

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Parents should set time limits on how long their girl or boy can use the internet each day.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 Correct! 

⏰ Setting time limits can help balance online activities with other important tasks, such as homework, chores, and physical activities.

📝 You can **create rules** together with Your Child about when they can play with devices and how to keep them safe online.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀 Oops! Check it out!

⏰ Setting time limits can help balance online activities with other important tasks, such as homework, chores, and physical activities.

📝 You can **create rules** together with Your Child about when they can play with devices and how to keep them safe online.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.question:
Here is another question. 

True or False: If Your Child comes across something upsetting or uncomfortable online, they should keep it to themselves and not tell anyone.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ Correct! 

💡 If Your Child encounters something online that upsets them, they should tell you immediately so you can address the issue and get support if needed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀Oops! Check it out!

💡 If Your Child encounters something online that upsets them, they should tell you immediately so you can address the issue and get support if needed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.question:
One more! 

True or false: It is safe for young children to have their social media accounts without parental supervision.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
⭐ Correct! 

🔑 Social media platforms like YouTube have age restrictions for a reason.

👀 Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, because they may see things or have conversations that are distressing or harmful.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
👀Oops! Check it out! 

🔑 Social media platforms like YouTube have age restrictions for a reason.

👀 Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, because they may see things or have conversations that are distressing or harmful.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.intro: {F2_SON_8} wants to play games on the phone. His grandfather, {F2_GRANDFATHER}, uses this opportunity to teach {F2_SON_8} about how to stay safe online:
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.1:
{F2_SON_8}: Can I use the phone to play games?

{F2_GRANDFATHER}: Sure! But let’s first learn how to be safe when using phones or tablets. First, the household rule is that you can only use the phone or tablet for 30 minutes each day. It is the length of one episode of your favourite cartoon. I will set a timer that will go off when you have 5 minutes left.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.2:
{F2_GRANDFATHER}: Always ask me or {F2_GRANDMOTHER} for permission before using any device or downloading any app. You should also only play games or watch videos that we have approved, okay?

{F2_SON_8}: Okay, {F2_GRANDFATHER}!

{F2_GRANDFATHER}: You are a great listener!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.3:
{F2_SON_8}: Can I create my own account for pictures and videos, Grandpa? {F2_DAUGHTER_17}has an account for herself.

{F2_GRANDFATHER}: We'll wait until you're a bit older, {F2_SON_8}. Social media is for older kids. What we can do is post pictures on my account together if you want.

{F2_SON_8}: Okay.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.comic.text.4:
{F2_GRANDFATHER}: Thank you for understanding. And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe! Let’s play for 5 minutes to practise what we agreed.

{F2_SON_8}: Yes, Grandpa! Thank you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱

Here are 4️⃣ tips that can help keep Your Child safe online: 
1️⃣ LEARN
2️⃣ PROTECT
3️⃣ BUILD HABITS
4️⃣ BUILD TRUST

🔑 Today, we are learning about LEARN and PROTECT. 

✨ The next lesson will cover BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ **LEARN** the dangers of being online:

🚩 CONTENT: Your Child might come across harmful content or content you think is inappropriate for them, such as violence, aggressive language, or pornography.

🚩 CONTACT: Adults might pretend to be children and ask for sexual pictures or to meet with your child through an online platform.

🚩 CONDUCT: Sometimes, children or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ **PROTECT** - Keep your girl or boy safe online:

✅ Talk to Your Child about which apps and websites are safe and which are not. Discuss why!

✅ Help Your Child learn how to make strong passwords to protect their devices. 

✅ Tell Your Child that they should keep personal information private, including photos or videos of themselves. What goes online stays online!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.video.message:

2️⃣ PROTECT
3️⃣ BUILD HABITS
4️⃣ BUILD TRUST

Here’s a video about LEARN and PROTECT.

Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.introduction.msg_list: This lesson continues our learning about keeping children safe online.📱
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.importance.msg_list:
The previous lesson taught you ways to protect Your Child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT.🔑

In this lesson, we will learn how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST. ✨
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.intro:
💡 Often, our children understand more about life online than we do, but that does not mean they know how to keep safe. 

⭐ Let’s test your online safety knowledge.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I send a picture to a friend, it will only be visible to them.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct. 

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
👀Oops! Check it out!

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ Remember, what goes online stays online!
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.question: My password is strong because you have to know my home address to guess it.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ That’s correct. 

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
👀Oops! Check it out!

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.question: Links sent to me by my family and friends are safe to click on.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
🎈 That’s right! 

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognise the web address, don’t click on it.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
👀Oops! Check it out!

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognise the web address, don’t click on it.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱 

You already learned ways to protect Your Child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT in the previous lesson.

Today, we are learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.1.text:
3️⃣ **BUILD HABITS** - Set up safe online habits at home: 

❌📱 Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.

❗ Set limits on the amount of time Your Child spends online. 

⭐ Only let Your Child chat online with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.

👀 Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.

📝 For older children, you can help them create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols.

❗ Tell Your Child not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.tips.message.2.text:
4️⃣ **BUILD TRUST**

🌷 Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps Your Child uses. 

👂 Ask questions - this helps you learn more about Your Child’s interests!

💙 If you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your child. If you need support, type {HELP} after you complete today’s lesson.  

✅ Tell Your Child that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.

🚩 Teach your child that if a stranger offers gifts, like virtual coins, in exchange for photos and personal information, and tells them to keep it a secret, they should tell you.
Keep My Child Safe & Healthy.video.message:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world.📱 

You already learned ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT in the previous lesson.

Here’s a 2nd video learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about taking care of yourself. 🌱
Understand Child Development.tips.intro: Here is a simple stretching and movement activity that may help you with stress:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. 
...
Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. 
...
Stretch to both sides. 
...
Stretch to the front and to the back.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
Let your hands hang by your side. 
...
Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. 
...
Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.3.text:
Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take four deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
...
Relax your arms, let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.4.text: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles. Remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.5.text: Now, shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
Understand Child Development.tips.message.6.text:
Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. 
...
Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out 4 more times.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.7.text:
Take a moment to reflect on your experience. 
...
Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
Understand Child Development.video.message: ▶️Press play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.
Understand Child Development.audio.message: ▶️Press play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.

Understand Child Development.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference in how you feel each day. ⭐
Understand Child Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference to how you feel each day. ⭐

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: 🧸 This lesson is about supporting Your Child to find joy in learning in a playful and fun way. 😃
Understand Child Development.importance.msg_list:
🎨 Playing with Your Child is important for their development and learning in and out of school. This is true for ALL children, including those living with physical and developmental disabilities. 

🚲 Did you know that playing also helps Your Child learn what is expected from them in the family and community and how to interact with others?
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Children learn more when they are told what to do instead of letting them explore and play.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct! 

🌷 Did you know that children naturally explore the world around them in a creative way?

🎨 Research shows that children learn best when doing things instead of listening to instructions. 

🧸 Creating opportunities for Your Child to explore the world through play is the best way to help them learn!
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🌷 Did you know that children naturally explore the world around them in a creative way?

🎨 Research shows that children learn best when doing things instead of listening to instructions.

🧸 Creating opportunities for Your Child to explore the world through play is the best way to help them learn!
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F3_MOTHER} wants to spend more time helping her son, {F3_SON_4}, learn by playing together. Let’s see how both of them do it:
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Hi, my love. Would you like to do something fun together?” 

**{F3_SON_4}**: “Ooooh yes!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: “What would you like to do?” 

**{F3_SON_4}**: “Build a house out of bed sheets!” 

**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Great idea! What do we need to do first?”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F3_SON_4}**: “First, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It’s our first wall! We can use clothing pins to keep up the sheet.”

**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Wow, well done for thinking through the steps so carefully.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4:
**{F3_MOTHER}**: “This is a wonderful bedsheet house, {F3_SON_4}”! 

**{F3_SON_4}**: “Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?” 

**{F3_MOTHER}**: “Yes, of course, {F3_SON_4}. That will be fun.”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro: Here are 2️⃣ two tips on how you can make learning playful and fun with Your Child:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ GET ACTIVE

⚽ Play games!

🌱 Creating time for Your Child to play and have fun will make their physical and mental health better.

✨ It also helps them learn and remember important facts better. Isn’t that great?

⏰ If Your Child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause or playing together. 

💡 Use Your Child’s interests in your play or exercise sessions to get them involved. Begin with something simple and then gradually make it more complex.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ ALLOW CREATIVITY

🎨 Allow Your Child to be creative when playing. For example, encourage Your Child to draw or go outside.

✨ If Your Child is interested in a new topic, talk to them about it and help them explore the topic through play.

💙 Set a good example: Let Your Child see you being creative and trying something new, even if you are not good at it yet.
Understand Child Development.video.message:
▶️Press Play to learn some steps you can use to make learning fun for Your Child:

1️⃣ **GET ACTIVE**
2️⃣ **ALLOW CREATIVITY**

Understand Child Development.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 Use the tips you have learnt today and have fun! Playing with Your Child is a great way to motivate them to learn and develop new skills. ⚽
Understand Child Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! 💙 If you don't have time today, set some time aside to play together tomorrow.

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: Today’s parenting lesson is about helping Your Child know how to learn from their mistakes. 💚
Understand Child Development.importance.msg_list:
Learning from our mistakes can help us avoid them in the future. 🌷

It can also help us be more supportive of ourselves and less harsh when things do not go well. 😃
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If my child understands their mistake and says sorry, that means I can bring up other mistakes they have made so that they learn.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🌷 That’s correct! 

✨ Your Child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them for realising and saying sorry. 💙

😔 Your Child may be tempted to hide mistakes from you out of fear if they don’t feel supported.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

✨ Your Child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them. 💙

😔 Your Child may be tempted to hide mistakes from you out of fear if they don’t feel supported.
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F3_DAUGHTER_7} is getting a bit too active indoors today. Let’s see how her uncle reacts:
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “{F3_DAUGHTER_7}, watch where you’re going! You’re going to break something.” 

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “No I won’t!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2: {F3_DAUGHTER_7} runs into a table and breaks a vase. {F3_UNCLE} sees and is concerned.
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “Are you hurt??”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “No, uncle. I’m so, so sorry for breaking the vase… I didn’t see it.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “Thank you for realising your mistake and apologising. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you warned me.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.5:
**{F3_UNCLE}**: “It’s OK, {F3_DAUGHTER_7}. I’m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Let’s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.”

**{F3_DAUGHTER_7}**: “Okay…”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro: Here are 4️⃣ four tips that you can use to help Your Child learn from their mistakes:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ TALK

👂 Create space and time for Your Child to talk with you about their life. 

💙 If their day was challenging, listen to them, and give space to let them share.

💛 Give them support and show you care. Tell them, "that sounds difficult.”
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ PRAISE EFFORT

💛 Praise Your Child for the effort they put into their learning even if they did not succeed.

✨ *Trying* something is more important than being able to do something perfectly.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN

🌱 Allow Your Child to make mistakes. Let them learn from their own mistakes so they can grow. 

❓ You may want to solve every problem for Your Child, especially when you know better. But this will not teach them to solve their own problems. 

😃 Talk to Your Child about their mistakes and allow them to figure out a way to solve their problems and do better next time.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ SHARE

📖 Try and share your own mistakes with Your Child and discuss how those helped you develop and grow. 

✅ This helps Your Child learn that you do not have to be perfect all the time.

2️⃣ **PRAISE EFFORT**
3️⃣ **ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN**
4️⃣ **SHARE**

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about helping you support Your Child’s healthy development as they grow and change. ✨
Understand Child Development.importance.msg_list:
Children have different abilities at different stages of their development. 🌱

It is important to be aware of Your Child’s skills at this stage. ⚽

This helps you plan activities for them that match what they can do and helps you have realistic expectations of them. ✨
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: All children develop at the same speed as each other.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
✅Correct! 

✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop faster than others in some ways, while some may take more time.

💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognising that every child has their own individual path of development. 

❗ Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.

🚩 If you have concerns about Your Child's development, you should seek help from a professional to get support and advice.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That is incorrect.

✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop faster than others in some ways, while some may take more time.

💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognizing that every child has their own individual path of development. 

❗Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.

🚩 If you have concerns about Your Child's development, you should seek help from a professional to get support and advice.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.question: Let's do another one! True or False: It is OK to let Your Child continue trying to do something a few times even if they are not doing it correctly.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ That’s correct! 

🚲 Your Child wants to learn, and you should support them to continue trying, even if they get it wrong.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🚲 Your Child wants to learn, and you should support them to continue trying, even if they get it wrong.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F1_DAUGHTER_2} and her father, {F1_FATHER} are spending time together. Let’s see how {F1_FATHER} encourages his daughter to keep on trying:
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “{F1_DAUGHTER_2}, I have 5 minutes to spend some time with you. What would you like to do?”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_2}**: “Let’s build a tower using blocks, {F1_FATHER}!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2:
**{F1_DAUGHTER_2}**: “I’m not good at this…”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “I can see that you are upset, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}. It’s not easy but let’s try again. I know you can do it.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “Wow! A tower of 10 blocks! You seem really proud to have made it to ten, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}!”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_2}**: “Let’s try 15!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4: **{F1_FATHER}**: “I am very happy to be able to spend this special time with you, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}!”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro:
At this stage of development, children are curious about their surroundings and want to learn how to do things on their own. 🌷 

They will begin to explore the world more and express themselves using emotions and language, too. 😃😒😔😣

To support the healthy development of Your Child, use these 3️⃣ three tips:
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE PATIENT

⏰ Be patient while they learn new things. They may struggle at first, but with time and practice, they will succeed. 

⭐ You can also support them by helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks appropriate for their age.

💚 Use words of encouragement to motivate them and praise each step.

🌷 Your Child may express feelings dramatically. This is OK! Your Child will learn to name and manage their emotions over time.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ EXPLORE SAFELY

 🚲 Your Child will become more curious and do more by themselves as they observe the world around them. Be aware of what they do, but encourage them to experience fun activities safely!

🌱 If Your Child wants to do tasks on their own, such as tying their own shoelaces or combing their own hair, you can teach them and help them do it safely.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ ENCOURAGE SHARING

🧸 Your Child may not like to lose or take turns, but sharing can be taught, especially through play!

🏆 Praise Your Child when they share their things with others.
Understand Child Development.video.message:
At this stage of development, children are curious about their surroundings and want to learn how to do things on their own. 🌷 
They will begin to explore the world more and express themselves using emotions and language, too. 😃😒😔😣
▶️ Press play to learn 2️⃣ two tips for supporting healthy development in Your Child.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🚲 Your Child is excited to try new things, and you should support them by explaining patiently, even if they get it wrong.

⭐ Praise them for wanting to try! Your Child will feel supported. Trying is more important than being good at something.
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F1_SON_5} is trying to put on his shoes.
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “Let me put your shoes on.”

**{F1_SON_5}**: “No, I want to do it myself!”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Okay, {F1_SON_5}, you can do it yourself.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2:
**{F1_SON_5}**: “I can’t do it!”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Yes, you can! Can I help you with one foot, and you do it with the other?”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3:
**{F1_SON_5}**: “Okay.”

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Hold your shoe in both your hands. Now, place your left foot in the shoe. Almost there! Wiggle your toes and make sure your heel is all the way in. Well done! Now, you try with your right shoe.”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4:
**{F1_SON_5}**: “I did it!” 

**{F1_FATHER}**: “Great job, {F1_SON_5}! You are becoming such a big boy!”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro:
At this age, children love playing and learning through actions. 🚲 

From these activities, they learn what is expected of them and how to interact with others. They will have a lot of questions about their environment. ✨

Here are 2️⃣ two tips to support the healthy development of Your Child at this age.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ LEARN BY PLAYING

⚽ Play, play, play! Through play, Your Child will develop relationships with other children and understand how to interact with others.

🚲 Your Child may not like to lose, share, or take turns, but losing and taking turns can be taught! Playing is a great way to do this!

🏆 Praise Your Child when they follow the rules, accept defeat, or play nicely with others.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ SUPPORT CURIOSITY

🧸 Your Child may find it hard to know fantasy from the real world, so they may express feelings in a bigger way than needed. That is alright! Your Child will learn to manage their emotions. 😃😒😔😣

🌱 Your Child may talk a lot and have many questions. You can give Your Child short but honest answers. 

💡 Your Child may repeat the question or ask follow-up questions to learn more. Take a pause and be calm as you support their interest in learning and continue to answer.
Understand Child Development.video.message:
▶️Press Play to learn about some steps for supporting healthy development in Your Child:
1️⃣ **LEARN BY PLAYING**
2️⃣ **SUPPORT CURIOSITY**
Understand Child Development.audio.message:
▶️Press Play to learn about some steps for supporting healthy development in Your Child:

1️⃣ **LEARN BY PLAYING**
2️⃣ **SUPPORT CURIOSITY**
Understand Child Development.home_activity.activity: Your home activity is to complete Your Child's development assessment. To get started, type {GROW}. Can you complete the assessment today? ⭐
Understand Child Development.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 This activity will help you better support Your Child’s development.
Understand Child Development.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! Try to complete this task during the week. You can type {GROW} at any time to begin.

Understand Child Development.introduction.msg_list: This lesson is about helping you support Your Child’s healthy development as they grow and change. ✨
Understand Child Development.importance.msg_list:
🌱 Children have different abilities at different stages of their development. 

⚽ It is important to be aware of Your Child’s skills at this stage. 

✨ This helps you plan activities for them that match what they can do and helps you have realistic expectations of them.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: All children develop at the same speed as each other.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
✅Correct! 

✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop faster than others in some ways, while some may take more time.

💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognizing that every child has their own individual path of development. 

❗Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.

🚩 If you have concerns about Your Child's development, you should seek help from a professional to get support and advice.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That is incorrect.

✨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop faster than others in some ways, while some may take more time.

💚 It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognising that every child has their own individual path of development. 

❗Remember that issues with your child’s development are not always obvious, and your child’s condition is NOT your fault.

🚩 If you have concerns about Your Child's development, you should seek help from a professional to get support and advice.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.question: Let’s do another short quiz! How can you respond if Your Child suddenly expresses interest in changing how they dress or their hairstyle?
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.values: Reject all their requests and say it is not necessary. | Warmly ask more about what influenced their interest to change and why. | Give in to all of Your Child’s interests.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.answer: Warmly ask more about what influenced their interest to change and why.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s right! 

💚 By warmly asking Your Child questions about their interests, they will feel comfortable sharing about the influences around them. 

🌷 You can gently give your opinions about their interests. 

⭐ You can also gently advise them which changes would work within your household and community.
Understand Child Development.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ Incorrect. 

💚 By warmly asking Your Child questions about their interests, they will feel comfortable sharing about the influences around them. 

🌷 You can gently give your opinions about their interests. 

⭐ You can also gently advise them which changes would work within your household and community.
Understand Child Development.comic.intro: {F1_FATHER} is helping his children, {F1_SON_5} and {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, learn how to play soccer and interact with each other well:
Understand Child Development.comic.text.1:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “Gently kick the ball using the inside of your foot, like this.”

**{F1_SON_5}**: “I want to do it now!!”

**{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: “No, I want to do it first!!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.2:
**{F1_FATHER}**: “It can be hard to wait, but we cannot all go first. {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, can you suggest a way for us to take turns kicking the ball?** 

**{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: “Okay! We can make a circle, and I kick the ball to {F1_SON_5}, then he kicks it to you {F1_FATHER}, and you kick it back to me!” 

**{F1_SON_5}**: “Yes, that sounds great!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.3: **{F1_FATHER}**: “That’s a fantastic idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Let’s give it a try!”
Understand Child Development.comic.text.4: **{F1_FATHER}**: “Well done, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! You took the lead, and we all had so much fun taking turns! {F1_SON_5}, you were also great at patiently waiting for your turn.”
Understand Child Development.tips.intro:
Children at this stage will start to express themselves by wanting independence and trust. 🎈

They begin making their own choices, and they may talk back to adults to show that they know the correct answers. 🎨⚽

At the same time, they will show emotions in their own unique ways. 😃😒😔😣

Here are 3️⃣ three tips to support the healthy development of Your Child at this age. 💚
Understand Child Development.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ FIND FRIENDS

🎨 Your Child will be interested in spending time with other children. 

⚽ Support Your Child to make friends based on their interests so that they develop relationships with other children.

💚 Help Your Child learn how to share and play with others in a safe and fun way.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ SUPPORT CURIOSITY

📖 Your Child will be interested in learning at school and may have favourite subjects. Encourage Your Child to ask you or the teacher about any topics they don’t understand. 

🌱 Your Child may begin expressing interest in religious matters or spirituality. You can give Your Child short but honest answers.
Understand Child Development.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ TRUST YOUR CHILD

 📝 Your Child may begin making decisions by themselves. They will want you to trust them. Listen to what Your Child wants and then set rules that work for the family. 

🏆 Praise Your Child when they follow the rules!
Understand Child Development.video.message:
▶️Press Play to learn about some steps for helping you support Your Child’s healthy development as they grow and change:
1️⃣ **FIND FRIENDS**
2️⃣ **SUPPORT CURIOSITY**
3️⃣ **TRUST YOUR CHILD**
Understand Child Development.audio.message:
▶️Press Play to learn about some steps for helping you support Your Child’s healthy development as they grow and change:

1️⃣ **FIND FRIENDS**
2️⃣ **SUPPORT CURIOSITY**
3️⃣ **TRUST YOUR CHILD**

Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list:
This goal is about preparing your child for success in school by helping them learn. 

These skills are a guide: use them as your child is ready for them. 💡

This first skill is about helping your child learn new words and improve their language skills! 👂
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list: Learning to talk and have conversations is important for learning to read and for doing well in school! 🎓
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: All children, no matter how they are growing, can learn and develop skills.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
✨You’re right! 

🎉 All children, no matter how they are growing, can learn and develop skills. 

🔑 Every child is different. They learn at different speeds, and what they can do changes with their age.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect! 

🎉 All children, no matter how they are growing, can learn and develop skills. 

🔑 Every child is different. They learn at different speeds, and what they can do changes with their age.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.2.question: Talking to your child is the same as talking with your child.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

🎈 Children learn new words and build confidence in their language abilities when we try to have a conversation with them.

🌷 Children may not know how to say many words, but it’s important to continue encouraging them!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🎈 Children learn new words and build confidence in their language abilities when we try to have a conversation with them.

🌷 Children may not know how to say many words, but it’s important to continue encouraging them!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.intro: {F1_FATHER} is a dad committed to positive parenting. Let’s see how he approaches time with his son, {F1_SON_5}:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.1: {F1_FATHER}: I see you are playing quietly with the blocks with concentration, {F1_SON_5}.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.2:
{F1_FATHER}: Wow! You are building such a tall and strong wall with those blocks. 

{F1_SON_5}: It is for cows.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.3:
{F1_FATHER}: It will keep the cows safe!

{F1_SON_5}: Now you can help me build a house for our family to sleep in!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.4: {F1_FATHER}: This house is going to keep our family warm and dry. You are such a good builder, {F1_SON_5}!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro:
5️⃣ Here are 5 tips on helping Your Child learn by talking with them. 

💙 Talk with your child as often as you can! Go down to Your Child’s level by kneeling or squatting so you can make eye contact when talking to them.
😃 This will improve your relationship with them as well as their behaviour, because they will understand more of what you say.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ EXPLAIN

😃 Talk with Your Child. Describe and explain what you are doing. For example, chat with them while shopping at the market. 🍅
👂 Ask Your Child questions and listen to their answers!
⏯️ Give your child learning opportunities at their own pace. When you give Your Child tasks that suit their abilities, it will boost their excitement for learning. 😃
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ ASK

💡 Help your child to talk more by asking questions that don’t have just ‘yes’ or ‘no’ answers.
✨ Ask questions like, “What would you like to do with your friend later?” or, “Did you do anything special in school today?”
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ LISTEN

👂 Let your child speak too.
⏰ Give them time to respond - they may need time to think and express, especially if they are giving longer answers!
😃 After giving them time, if it is difficult for them to say what they want, you can help them with prompts!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ BUILD

👂Listen to your child and always respond. 
🔄 Confirm what they said and add more to help them connect their understanding to new language. For example, if your child says, “There’s a cat,” you could respond, “Yes, there’s a cat making a big hole in the ground”.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.5.text:
5️⃣ TELL STORIES

🎈 Tell your child stories! They can be real, made up, about your lives, or read to them from books.
😃 Encourage your child to tell stories too. You could show photos and create a story together!
🔄 Be patient! It takes lots of practice to listen to stories, and even more to learn the skill of telling them. 💙
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message:
💙 Talk with your child as often as you can! Go down to Your Child’s level by kneeling or squatting so you can make eye contact when talking to them.
 
😃 This will improve your relationship with them as well as their behaviour, because they will understand more of what you say.

Press Play to learn 5️⃣ five more tips on helping Your Child learn:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: Press Play to learn 5️⃣ five more tips on helping Your Child learn:

Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent! Using words and gestures that Your Child can understand to describe your activities is a great way to help them learn! 💡
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. Try to find a time to talk to them, even if it’s just explaining something you’re doing around the house! 💡
Prepare My Child for Success in School.congratulations.msg_list: Well done! 🎉 You have learned about helping your child’s language skills! You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Prepare my Child for Success in School.✨

Prepare My Child for Success in School.module_name: Help Your Child Learn to Read, Part 1
Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list:
📖This skill is about helping your child learn to read. 

2️⃣This skill will take 2 days to complete. 

⭐ Our first lesson today is about enjoying books with your child.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list:
Reading with your child is the best way to help your child learn to read. 📖🎉

Children learn by watching, listening, and copying. When you read to them when they are little, they learn new words. Later they learn letters and letter sounds, and when they’re bigger, reading together can help them learn about anything they are interested in! 💡
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Reading with Your Child only involves reading the words with the correct emotions.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

👂 While it’s fun to read with emotions, it can also help to ask children questions and explore the story with them.

🔑 Your Child will practise saying new words and develop an interest in reading.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

👂 While it’s fun to read with emotions, it can also help to ask children questions and explore the story with them.

🔑 Your Child will practise saying new words and develop an interest in reading.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.intro: Let’s see how {F1_FATHER} reads with his son, {F1_SON_5}. Notice how he uses the pictures in the book to teach.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.1: {F1_FATHER}: Wow, this book looks interesting! Can you see the picture? It has a tiger who is smiling. What do you think the book is about?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.2:
{F1_FATHER}: Wow, what is happening here? What is the tiger holding?
{F1_SON_5}: A balloon!
{F1_FATHER}: That’s right, it's a balloon, what colour is it?
{F1_SON_5}: Red!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.3: {F1_FATHER}: Yes, it’s a red balloon! Why do you think the tiger is holding the red balloon? Do you think it’s his birthday? Yes! The tiger is holding the red balloon because it’s his birthday!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.4: {F1_FATHER}: What is the first sound of “balloon”? “B”? That’s right, this letter makes the sound “B”! Can you think of any other words that start with “B”? Yes! “Ball also starts with “B”. If you can’t think of any more I can help! What about “basket”?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro:
4️⃣ Here are four ways to help your child learn reading skills: Make Routines ⏰, Ask Questions, Respond and Explore 👀, and Build and Connect 😃

If reading is difficult for you, just use books with pictures. Describe what you see and talk about the pictures with Your Child using language that your child can understand. This will still help them learn! 💙
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ MAKE ROUTINES 

📖 You can share books with your child anywhere! 
Choose a good place at home to share books. Get rid of any distractions (like turning off the TV 📺❌). 
⏰ Pick a time every day when you can share books with your child. 
💡 If your child wants to, let them choose a book 😃
✨ If you don’t have any books in your home - you can use anything with words and pictures, like old magazines or newspapers!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ ASK QUESTIONS 

⭐ From the book cover, ask your child what they think the story might be about. 
➡️ Throughout the book, ask your child who, what, where, when, why, and how questions.
✨ If you have read a story many times, see if your child knows what comes next! 
👀 Describe what’s happening in a picture. Always use language that your child can understand. 
💡 Ask your child to retell the story.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ RESPOND AND EXPLORE

👀 Notice what your child is interested in and talk about it. Help them understand the story, words, sounds, letters, and character emotions. 💚
📖 Explore by rephrasing or adding more information - help your child learn new words and understand the book more 😃
👂 Respond positively and encourage them, even if what they are wrong.
😃 Ask your child to repeat what you have taught them.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ BUILD AND CONNECT

💙 Help your child build confidence by asking questions that they might know the answer to or that encourage them to go a bit further with their skill! 
🎨 Always connect what’s in the book to your child’s experience.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message:
4️⃣ Here are four ways to help your child learn reading skills. 

If reading is difficult for you, just use books with pictures. Describe what you see and talk about the pictures with Your Child using language that your child can understand. This will still help them learn! 💙
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: 4️⃣ Here are four ways to help your child learn reading skills
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Can you read with your child today? ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent! Reading with your child is a great way to help them learn!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. It’s not always possible to read with your child. Try to find a little bit of time every day because it will help your child learn.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.congratulations.msg_list: Well done! 🎉 You have learnt the first part about helping your child learn reading skills! You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Prepare my Child for Success in School.✨

Prepare My Child for Success in School.module_name: Help Your Child Learn to Read, Part 2
Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list:
Hello! Today, we are learning more about helping your child become a better reader. 

📖 It is about word games and writing. 📝
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list:
Learning to read begins with understanding language, letters, and sounds. 🎵 

Understanding the sounds in words and starting to write letters will help your child learn to read. 📖⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: You should start reading books with your child only once they’ve begun to learn in school.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🌷 That’s correct. 

⭐ Parents should read with their child early in life. You can actually start from the day they are born!

🏆 Reading with children is a great way to prepare them for success in school.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

⭐ Parents should read with their child early in life. You can actually start from the day they are born!

🏆 Reading with children is a great way to prepare them for success in school.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro: 4️⃣ Here are four more ways to help your child learn reading skills: Use Books to Learn, Notice Letters, Play Word Games, and Start Writing.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ USE BOOKS TO LEARN

💡 Books with no words help with imagination, ideas, and learning new words. Together, name and describe what is in the pictures. 
⭐ Books with words help to understand letters, sounds, and what different words look like.
🎵 Focus on words that rhyme, repeat, and start with the same letter, like “big black boot.”
➡️ Point to each word and say it aloud to help your child recognise some of the letters and sounds!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ NOTICE LETTERS

👀 Look for letters everywhere, such as on signs and packages.
💡Point the letters out to your child and name them.
👂 Ask your child to find letters and name them, too!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ PLAY WORD GAMES

🎵 Sing and rhyme with your child to help them learn about the different sounds that make words.
👋 Break up names or words into syllables. Clap with your child while saying each syllable - start with just 2!
🔄 Change some sounds or letters in words to make new words, like “cat, pat, mat.” Then, repeat the sounds that were changed: “c”, “p”, “m”
👀 Help your child identify “beginning sounds,” “middle sounds,” and “end sounds” - and letters that make these.
✅ Once they understand letters and sounds in different places in words, help your child put the parts of a word together to make the whole word!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ START WRITING 📝

🧸🌷 Encourage your child to draw. They can start by drawing things they like, such as animals or flowers.
▶️ Next, show them how to draw shapes that look like letters: 🔵🔶
😃 Later, help them write simple letters. Start with the first letter of their name! 
🔄 Practise and add letters until they can write their whole name. Then learn letters in other words!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ four more tips on helping your child learn to read.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ four more tips on helping your child learn to read.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Can you draw or write with your child today? ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent! Drawing and writing with your child is a great way to help them learn! 📝
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. It’s not always possible to do this with your child. Try to find a bit of time to write with your child every day - it will help them learn! 📝
Prepare My Child for Success in School.congratulations.msg_list: Well done! 🎉 You have learnt the second part of the skill to help your child learn reading skills! You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Prepare my Child for Success in School. ✨

Prepare My Child for Success in School.module_name: Get Your Child Ready for Maths, Part 1
Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about introducing your child to numbers and maths. 1️⃣2️⃣3️⃣
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list:
⭐ Learning about numbers, shapes, and groups will help your child understand basic maths. 

🎓 This will prepare them to succeed in school.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.intro: Let’s do a quiz. Select the correct option:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: Where do children learn maths?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.values: In school | from their friends | at home | watching educational TV shows | all of the above
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s right! 

🌷 Children don’t just learn maths in school. 

💙 They can learn maths in lots of ways - and you can help!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🌷 Children don’t just learn maths in school. 

💙 They can learn maths in lots of ways - and you can help!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro:
3️⃣ Here are three ways to help your child learn number skills: Count, Look for Numbers, and Learn with Shapes. 

Remember: maths, numbers, amounts of things, and shapes are everywhere! 🔶🌷🔵

You can use what is around you and your daily routines to talk to your child about maths. ⏰ This will help prepare them for success. ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ COUNT

 🔴 Counting is a skill your child can start to learn early. 1️⃣2️⃣3️⃣

🚗 Ask your child to count things around you: cars, people, houses, how many steps between one place and another, and their fingers and toes! 👋

🍅 Ask your child to count things in daily activities: count things while cooking, like potatoes, while sorting out clothes, like socks, or while at the supermarket.

🎵 Sing songs that include numbers with your child.

🎨 Encourage your child to draw things, and ask them how many things there are in the pictures.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ LOOK FOR NUMBERS

📱Numbers are all around us if you look for them. They’re on food packaging, and even on the TV remote.

👀 Wherever you see a number, ask your child what it is. 

😃 Help them if they don’t know!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ LEARN WITH SHAPES

🔷 Learning about shapes is also important in maths! Shapes are everywhere, too, so find them and talk about them. You could even make them! 👀
🔴 Help your child draw different shapes. 
🔵 If you can, cut them out and help your child sort them into groups (by colour, shape, size, or however else your child wants!) Ask them why they are sorting in that way.
🔶 Talk about the shapes with your child, and have fun with them! 😃
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message:
▶️Press play to learn 3️⃣ three ways you can help Your Child gain number skills. 

Remember: maths, numbers, amounts of things, and shapes are everywhere! 🔶🌷🔵

You can use what is around you and your daily routines to talk to your child about maths. ⏰ This will help prepare them for success. ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: ▶️Press play to learn 3️⃣ three ways you can help Your Child gain number skills
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐ Try to involve your child in an activity with numbers. For example, counting the amount of ingredients when you are cooking. Can you do it today?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 Involving your child in activities like this and talking about numbers and amounts of things will help them learn!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, try to involve your child tomorrow. Activities that use numbers and talking about amounts of things will help your child learn!

Prepare My Child for Success in School.module_name: Get Your Child Ready for Maths, Part 2
Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list:
Today we will continue with the skill “Help your child get ready for maths.” ✨

Here, we are focusing on some more challenging activities that you can do with your child once they are ready 💡
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list: Learning about comparing, adding, and subtracting will help your child understand more about maths. This will continue to help them learn number skills. 🔟/🔟 ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.intro: Let’s see how {F1_MOTHER} is practising numbers with her son, {F1_SON_5} in the kitchen:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.1:
{F1_MOTHER}: Thank you for cooking with me! You’re so helpful! What do you have here?
{F1_SON_5}: Potatoes!
{F1_MOTHER}: That’s right! Potatoes! How many potatoes do you have?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.2:
{F1_SON_5}: Five!
{F1_MOTHER}: That’s right! One, two, three, four… five! Five potatoes!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.3:
{F1_MOTHER}: Can you give me two potatoes?
That’s right! One… two…! 
How many potatoes are left?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.4:
{F1_MOTHER}: Is it difficult? Don’t worry, let’s count together! Let’s see… we had five, and you gave me two, now there are one… two… three remaining! There are three potatoes left!
{F1_SON_5}: Three potatoes left!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro:
Once your child knows about numbers and groups of things, they can start learning more number skills⭐

Remember to go slowly and have fun with things that your child can nearly do! 😃

4️⃣ Here are four ways for you to encourage your child to practise his number skills:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ SORTING AND ORGANISING

🌱 Ask your child to help sort things into groups, such as putting all the leaves together when cooking. 
😃 Ask your child to find 5 of something, and then to order them from smallest to biggest. You can use something like sticks.
⬆️ Then order them a different way, like from lightest to darkest! 
✨ Help your child think about groups! Say: “A potato is a round red vegetable. Can you think of something else that is red like a potato?” Then: “Can you think of something that is also round but bigger than a potato?” ⚽
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ ADDING AND TAKING AWAY

⬆️⬇️ Once they know about numbers, your child might be able to start learning about adding and taking away!
🍚 Use activities similar to counting exercises, like cooking, sorting clothes, shopping, or building things!
🍅 Say “I have two potatoes. When I add two more, how many do I have?” Help your child get the answer! Keep practising and, after a while, make it more difficult!
⚽ Try the activity with different things like balls or shoes.
⬇️ Repeat the activity, but take things away: “I have five potatoes. When I take two away, how many do I have?”
🔄 Practise anywhere and everywhere! You can also do the game in your imaginations.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ WAYS TO MAKE A NUMBER

⏰ Once your child is old enough and has learned some number skills, they can start learning harder skills.
5️⃣ If you think they are ready, ask them to find 5 stones. Show them that you can make 5 stones with one group of 1 stone and another of 4 stones; then show them with one group of 2 and one group of 3.
🔟 When they are ready for more difficult challenges, do the same activity with more stones, up to 10.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ ENCOURAGE AND HAVE FUN

💚 Remember, go slowly and help your child build confidence by doing things that they are ready for and know how to do. 
😃 Always encourage their effort and praise them. Wrong answers are okay, too!
🎉 Try to make learning fun and enjoyable to your child. It will make them more likely to keep trying.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message:
Once your child knows about numbers and groups of things, they can start learning more number skills⭐

Remember to go slowly and have fun with things that your child can nearly do! 😃

▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ four ways you can encourage your child to practise his number skills.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ four ways you can encourage your child to practise his number skills.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐ Can you do an activity with adding and taking away with your child? You can do that while cooking with them again, or with other objects - like playing outside with stones!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 These activities will help your child learn!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, try to do some adding and taking away activities with your child tomorrow.

Prepare My Child for Success in School.module_name: Help Your Child Learn to Read
Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list: 📖This skill is about helping your child learn skills to prepare them for reading when they are older. ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list:
Reading with your child is the best way to help your child learn to read. 🔑

It is one of the best ways to help them learn to read themselves and develop well. 🎉

When they’re little, they learn new words, and it helps with attention and language! 💡
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Reading with Your Child only involves reading the words with the correct emotions.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

👂 While it’s fun to read with emotions, it is more effective to ask children questions and explore their response and the story with them.

🔑 Your Child will practise saying new words and develop an interest in reading.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

👂 While it’s fun to read with emotions, it is more effective to ask children questions and explore their response and the story with them.

🔑 Your Child will practise saying new words and develop an interest in reading.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.intro: Let’s watch {F1_FATHER} read with his daughter, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}. Notice how he asks the child lots of questions and describes things.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.1: {F1_FATHER}: Wow, this book looks interesting! Can you see the picture? It has a tiger who is smiling. What do you think the book is about?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.2:
{F1_FATHER}: Wow, what is happening here? What is the tiger holding?
{F1_DAUGHTER_2}: A balloon!
{F1_FATHER}: That’s right, it's a balloon, what colour is it?
{F1_DAUGHTER_2}: Red!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.3:
{F1_FATHER}: Yes, it’s a red balloon! Why do you think the tiger is holding the red balloon? 
{F1_DAUGHTER_2}: Because it is his birthday!
{F1_FATHER}: Do you think it’s his birthday? Yes! The tiger is holding the red balloon because it’s his birthday!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.comic.text.4:
{F1_FATHER}: Do you remember when we attended your cousin’s birthday? What colour balloons did he have?
{F1_DAUGHTER_2}: Blue, pink, and yellow!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro: 5️⃣ Here are five ways to prepare your child for learning how to read when they are older. The activities all focus on reading books together 💙
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ SHARE BOOKS 

💡 Books with no words help with imagination, ideas, and learning new words. Together, name and describe what is in the pictures.Try to communicate in a way that your child can understand. 
⭐ Books with words help to understand letters and sounds!
🎵 Focus on words that rhyme, repeat, and start with the same letter, like “big black boot.”
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣MAKE ROUTINES 

📖 You can share books with your child anywhere! 
Choose a good place at home to share books. Get rid of any distractions (like turning off the TV 📺❌). 
⏰ Pick a time every day when you can share books with your child. 
💡 If your child wants to, let them choose a book 😃
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ ASK QUESTIONS 

👀 From the book cover, ask your child what they think the story might be about. 
➡️ Throughout the book, ask your child who, what, where, when, why, and how questions.
✨ When your child doesn’t know the name of the object you pointed at, point at it and say what it is. This will help your child learn new words.
☀️ If you have read a story many times, see if your child knows what comes next! 
👀 Describe what’s happening in a picture.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ RESPOND AND EXPLORE

👀 Notice what your child is interested in and talk about it. Help them understand the story and character emotions. 💚
🎈 Explore their responses by rephrasing or adding more information - help your child learn new words and understand the book more 😃
💙 When your child talks about the book or answers your questions about the book, respond positively and encourage them, even if they are wrong.
👂 Ask your child to repeat what you have taught them.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.5.text:
5️⃣ CONNECT

🌷 Always connect what’s in the book to your child’s experience.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message: ▶️Press play to learn the 5️⃣ five ways to prepare your child for learning how to read when they are older.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: ▶️Press play to learn the 5️⃣ five ways to prepare your child for learning how to read when they are older.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Can you read with your child today? ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent! Reading with your child is a great way to help them learn!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. It’s not always possible to read with your child. Try to find a little bit of time every day because it will help your child learn.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.congratulations.msg_list: Well done! 🎉 You have learnt the first part about helping your child learn reading skills! You have completed@(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Prepare my Child for Success in School.✨

Prepare My Child for Success in School.module_name: Get Your Child Ready for Maths
Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about introducing your child to numbers and maths. 1️⃣2️⃣3️⃣
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list:
⭐ Learning about numbers, shapes, and groups will help your child understand basic maths. 

🎓 This will prepare them to succeed in school.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.intro: Let’s do a quiz. Select the correct option:
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: Where do children learn maths?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.values: In school | from their friends | at home | watching educational TV shows | all of the above
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s right! 

🌷 Children don’t just learn maths in school. 

💙 They can learn maths in lots of ways - and you can help!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

🌷 Children don’t just learn maths in school. 

💙 They can learn maths in lots of ways - and you can help!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro:
3️⃣ Here are three ways to help your child learn number skills: Count, Look for Numbers, and Learn with Shapes. 

Remember: maths, numbers, amounts of things, and shapes are everywhere! 🔶🌷🔵

You can use what is around you and your daily routines to talk to your child about maths. ⏰ This will help prepare them for success. ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ COUNT

 🔴 Counting is a skill your child can start to learn early. 1️⃣2️⃣3️⃣
🚗 Ask your child to count things around you: cars, people, houses, how many steps between one place and another, and their fingers and toes! 👋
🍅 Ask your child to count things in daily activities: count things while cooking, like potatoes, while sorting out clothes, like socks, or while at the supermarket.
🎵 Sing songs that include numbers with your child.
🎨 Encourage your child to draw things, and ask them how many things there are in the pictures.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ LOOK FOR NUMBERS

📱Numbers are all around us if you look for them. They’re on food packaging, and even on the TV remote.
👀 Wherever you see a number, ask your child what it is. 
😃 Help them if they don’t know!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ LEARN WITH SHAPES

🔷 Help your child learn about shapes! Shapes are everywhere, too, so find them and talk about them. You could even make them! 👀
🔴 Help your child draw different shapes. 
🔵 If you can, cut them out and help your child sort them into groups (by colour, shape, size, or however else your child wants!) Ask them why they are sorting in that way.
🔶 Talk about the shapes with your child, and have fun with them! 😃
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message:
▶️Press play to learn 3️⃣ three ways you can help your child learn number skills. 

Remember: maths, numbers, amounts of things, and shapes are everywhere! 🔶🌷🔵

You can use what is around you and your daily routines to talk to your child about maths. ⏰ This will help prepare them for success. ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: ▶️Press play to learn 3️⃣ three ways you can help your child learn number skills
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐ Can you do some counting with your child today?
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 Counting with your child will introduce them to numbers!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, try to count with your child tomorrow. This will help your child learn!

Prepare My Child for Success in School.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about connecting with your child’s school and their teacher(s). 📖✨
Prepare My Child for Success in School.importance.msg_list:
Talking to your child’s teacher(s) will help you understand what your child is doing in school. ⭐

You will also know what kinds of things Your Child can do at home to learn better, and how you can help your child! 🎓
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Knowing what my child is doing in school won’t help them learn.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct. 

💡 If you know what your child is learning in school, you can help your child learn by talking to them about it and practising with them at home!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

💡 If you know what your child is learning in school, you can help your child learn by talking to them about it and practising with them at home!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.intro: 4️⃣ Here are four ways to engage with your child’s school and the things they are learning about.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ CONNECT 

👋 Make sure you know your child’s teacher and have their phone number.
👂 Each time you have the chance to speak to your child’s teacher, ask them what your child is doing in school, and how you can help them.
🔔 Let the teacher and school know that you are available to receive messages about anything related to the school and your child’s learning.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ ASK 🔑

👂 Ask your child what they have been doing in school.
😃 Did they do or see something they liked? Were they interested in anything particular?
👀 Notice what they like and what interests them. Ask them questions and talk about these interests .
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ PRACTISE 🔄

🎨 If your child has been doing something in school that they can do at home, help them practise it! For example, if they enjoyed working with colours at school, ask them to find as many colours as they can around the home.
📖 If they can bring books home from school, read them together! 
💡If something in school was difficult, see if you can help your child understand it!
Prepare My Child for Success in School.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ GET INVOLVED 🏁

🚗 If you have time, attend events or meetings at your child’s school. Find out as much as you can when you do.
⏰ If you have time, volunteer to help with activities happening with your child’s school! This will help you get to know the school, teachers, and the other parents 😃
Prepare My Child for Success in School.video.message: 4️⃣ Here are four ways to engage with your child’s school and the things they are learning about.
Prepare My Child for Success in School.audio.message: Here’s an audio message about engaging with your child’s school 🎵
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! Talk to your child about what they are doing at school at the moment. Can you do it today? ⭐
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.positive_msg: Excellent! See if you can practise what they learned in school at home! 😃
Prepare My Child for Success in School.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s okay. There isn’t always time to speak about school properly. Ask them about school next time they have been, even if it’s just for a few minutes, or while eating together! 😃
Prepare My Child for Success in School.congratulations.msg_list: Well done! 🎉 You have finished the lesson on engaging with your child’s school! You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Prepare my Child for Success in School.✨

Give My Child Structure.introduction.msg_list: Today’s skill is all about how to help your child follow instructions. 😃
Give My Child Structure.importance.msg_list:
Even the best behaved children only follow instructions about 50% of the time. ⏰

Being more effective about how we give instructions can make things more peaceful and calm at home. 🌱
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.question: True or false: It does not matter whether you give an instruction in a positive or negative way.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

Children are more likely to follow an instruction when it is worded in a positive way. 

💙 Negative instructions like, “Don’t do that!” can make children (and us) feel bad 😣
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

Children are more likely to follow an instruction when it is worded in a positive way. 

💙 Negative instructions like, “Don’t do that!” can make children (and us) feel bad 😣
Give My Child Structure.comic.intro: {F3_DAUGTHER_4} is playing with the handphone on the floor.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.1:
{F3_MOTHER}: It is nice to see you playing quietly with the handphone while I clear up after dinner, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the handphone back to me.

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay, Mummy.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.2:
{F3_MOTHER}: {after 3 minutes] 3 minutes is over, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Please give me back the phone.

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.3:
{F3_MOTHER}: Thank you very much for giving me the phone when I asked you, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Because you listened so well, I will read you an extra story tonight.

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Yay!
Give My Child Structure.tips.intro: 3️⃣ Here are three tips on how to help Your Child follow instructions more often:
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE SPECIFIC

⭐Say the behaviour you want your child to do. For example: “Please take your shoes off when you come inside, Adam.”
👀Use your child’s name to get your child’s attention. Go down to their level. Get their eye contact.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ BE REALISTIC

⭐Make sure that the instruction is something that your child can do. 
💡Give one instruction at a time. It can be difficult for your child to remember many instructions! 
⏰If possible, give a transition warning: “In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the cellphone back to me.”
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ BE POSITIVE

⭐Use positive words when giving instructions. For example, instead of “Don’t shout,” say “Talk in a quiet voice.”
💡Give instructions in a firm voice and stay calm. Behave as if you expect your child to do what you ask.
🎁Praise, praise, praise! Make sure you praise your child immediately when they follow your instruction.
🌷Also, be kind to yourself if you forget sometimes. Learning how to give positive instructions is not easy, but it works! 💙
Give My Child Structure.video.message: ▶️ This video teaches you 3️⃣ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
Give My Child Structure.audio.message: ▶️ This audio message teaches you 3️⃣ three tips to help your child follow instructions more often
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐Try to give specific, realistic, and positive instructions with your child. Do you have time to do this today? ⏰
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.positive_msg: 🎉That's great! Try to remember to praise your child whenever they follow your instruction. You can do it!
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.negative_msg: 💚That's OK! Learning something new takes time, patience, and practice. You might want to start by thinking of 1 instruction that you find yourself giving your child a lot of the time. Practice with your partner first! 🔄
Give My Child Structure.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! 🎉 You have learnt how to Help Your Child Follow Instructions! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Give My Child Structure. 🏆

Give My Child Structure.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about creating family rules and guidelines with Your Child.⏰⭐
Give My Child Structure.importance.msg_list:
Family rules can help our children stay safe from danger, both inside our homes and in the community.🌷

Your Child is more likely to follow these rules if you involve them in making them. ⭐
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.question: True or false: Family rules should be set by the parents because our children are too young to decide for themselves.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

📝 Including children in discussions on family rules help them to feel appreciated and heard.

⏰ They are more likely to follow the rule if they helped to develop the rule.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

📝 Including children in discussions on family rules help them to feel appreciated and heard.

⏰ They are more likely to follow the rule if they helped to develop the rule.
