Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.question: Let’s try another True/False question: Setting limits through household rules, daily routines, and healthy living is bad for Your Child because you are not allowing them to think on their own.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
⭐ You are right! 

💚 Setting reasonable limits with Your Child is a good form of positive discipline. 

🧸 You are not controlling Your Child too much. 

🌷 You are giving Your Child structure to maintain a positive parent-child relationship and explore the world safely.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ Incorrect. 

💚 When you set reasonable limits with Your Child, you are not controlling Your Child too much. 

🌷 You are giving Your Child structure to maintain a positive parent-child relationship and explore the world safely.

🧸 Setting reasonable limits with Your Child is a good form of positive discipline.
Give My Child Structure.comic.intro: {F1_SON_5} is spending too much time watching TV before his homework is finished. Let’s see how his mother, {F1_MOTHER}, helps him create a family rule about this:
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.1:
{F1_MOTHER}: It is important that you get your homework done so you can do well in school. Let’s make a rule about watching TV.

{F1_SON_5}: Okay, Ibu.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.2:
{F1_MOTHER}: What do you think would be a fair rule?

{F1_SON_5}: Hmmm…well, maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.3:
{F1_MOTHER}: I like that idea, but let’s limit it to 1 hour per day. How does that sound?

{F1_SON_5} Fine.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.4:
{F1_MOTHER}: Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, {F1_SON_5}. Your grades have improved, too! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour and a half each day…as long as you still do your homework first!

{F1_SON_5}: Thank you, Ibu!
Give My Child Structure.tips.intro: 4️⃣ Here are four easy tips to help you make family rules with Your Child:
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE A TEAM

📝 Create rules with Your Child. You can write these down or use pictures when needed to help your Child understand.
⏸ Make one rule at a time.
🔑 Talk about the reasons for the rule.
👂 Listen to their view.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ KEEP IT REAL

⭐ Make rules realistic: What can Your Child actually do?
📖 Be clear and specific about what you want them to do.
✅ Make sure the rule is fair. Explain the reason for the rule.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ BE CONSISTENT

🔄 Once you set a rule, stick to it. 
⬆️ This means they are more likely to follow the rule.
▶️ If the rule includes you, it is important that you stick to it too.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ PRAISE, PRAISE, PRAISE

⭐ Praise Your Child for setting a family rule with you. 
😃 Praise Your Child when they follow the rule, just like you do when they behave well!
Give My Child Structure.video.message: ▶️ Press play and learn 4️⃣ four easy tips to help you make family rules with Your Child.
Give My Child Structure.audio.message: ▶️ Press play and learn 4️⃣ four easy tips to help you make family rules with Your Child.
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.activity:
Create at least one family rule with Your Child.📝

Can you do it today?
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.positive_msg: That's great to hear! Create one family rule with Your Child today. Remember, when you involve Your Child in making rules, they are more likely to follow them. It's a recipe for success! 🏆
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! Setting rules takes time and practice. ⏰ Think about the rules you would like to set and, when you feel more confident, talk about these rules with Your Child. 👂 Remember, you can always review this skill in the Main Menu!
Give My Child Structure.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! 🎉 You have learnt how to make rules with your child! You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Give My Child Structure. 🏆

Give My Child Structure.introduction.msg_list:
Caregivers and children all have a role to play in the household. 📝 

Your child’s role is to listen to and learn from their caregivers. They can also start doing chores appropriate for their age. ⭐
;
As a caregiver, your role is to care for your child, keep them safe, and teach them how to behave in the world. 🌱

Your most important role is to help your child feel loved and supported, no matter what! 💙
Give My Child Structure.importance.msg_list: If your child feels loved and supported at home, they are more likely to happily do chores and to grow into a healthy child and adult! 😃💚
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I make a mistake or do something that upsets my child, I should pretend it didn’t happen, smile at them, and do a more positive activity with them.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🏆 Correct! 

💛 Admitting mistakes and apologising teaches them to respect others and that it is okay to get things wrong sometimes.

❗ Ignoring a mistake when it affects your child teaches them that they do not need to take responsibility for their actions.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s not right. 

💛 Admitting mistakes and apologising teaches them to respect others and that it is okay to get things wrong sometimes.

❗ Ignoring a mistake when it affects your child teaches them that they do not need to take responsibility for their actions.
Give My Child Structure.tips.intro: 4️⃣ Here are four tips to help you know what your role is as your child’s caregiver and to teach them their role, too.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ KNOW YOUR ROLE

As a caregiver, your role is to make sure Your Child:
🔷 has enough healthy food,
🔷 has the clothes they need,
🔷 stays safe from harm,
🔷 contributes to family needs, like doing chores, 
🔷 learns the morals and values you wish them to, such as honesty,
🔷 has opportunities to express themselves,
🔷 has opportunities to play, and
🔷 feels loved and supported, no matter what.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ TEACH

Tell Your Child what their role in the family is. This can include:
🔶 doing age-appropriate chores, like putting their toys away, making their beds, and sort laundry
🔶 listening when their caregivers ask something of them
🔶 being respectful to others in the family
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ DO AS I DO

👀 Your child will learn from your actions much more than from the words you tell them. They notice more than you might think!
🌷 Treat your child and those around you in the way you would want your child to act: with respect, kindness, patience, and love.
❌ Shouting at or hitting your child will only teach them to hit others when they are upset.
💚 Talk to them calmly and set a clear consequence so they learn to be calm with themselves and with others. You’ll learn more about consequences in the next goal.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ NOTICE

🎨 Notice what your child enjoys doing, and help them do more of it. 
✨ If Your Child feels as if their needs and interests are respected, they are more likely to willingly do their chores in the home!
🎁 Notice and praise them when they do the tasks that are their responsibility so they learn what is expected of them. This way, they are more likely to do it again.
Give My Child Structure.video.message: ▶️ Press play to watch a video message about everyone’s role in the home. 💡
Give My Child Structure.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to hear a message about everyone’s role in the home. 💡
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐ Talk to Your Child about one of their interests or something they love doing and show them you love and support them for their passion. This shows them they are a valued member of your home. 💛 Do you have time to do it today?
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 This will help Your Child feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour.
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, set some time aside tomorrow. Talking to Your Child about something they like helps them feel loved and supported, which can lead to better behaviour!
Give My Child Structure.congratulations.msg_list:
Skill complete! You have learnt about the roles you and your family members have at home.
;
You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Give My Child Structure.
⭐

Give My Child Structure.introduction.msg_list:
This skill is about how to keep Your Child safe online. 📱

There is so much to share. We will cover online safety over two lessons. 2️⃣
Give My Child Structure.importance.msg_list:
Children are spending a lot of time online. ⏰

Being connected helps them stay positive and learn more! 🔑

But there are also some risks and dangers. 🚩
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: Parents should set time limits on how long their child can use the internet each day.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 Correct! 

⏰ Setting time limits can help balance online activities with other important tasks, such as homework, chores, and physical activities.

📝 You can create rules together with Your Child about when they can play with devices and how to keep them safe online.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ Incorrect. 

⏰ Setting time limits can help balance online activities with other important tasks, such as homework, chores, and physical activities.

📝 You can create rules together with Your Child about when they can play with devices and how to keep them safe online.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.question: Here is another question. True or false: If Your Child comes across something upsetting or uncomfortable online, they should keep it to themselves and not tell anyone.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ Correct! 

💡 If Your Child encounters something distressing or inappropriate online, they should tell you immediately so you can address the issue and get support if needed.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ Incorrect. 

💡 If Your Child encounters something distressing or inappropriate online, they should tell you immediately so you can address the issue and get support if needed.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.3.question: One more! True or false: It is safe for young children to have their social media accounts without parental supervision.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
⭐ Correct! 

🔑 Social media platforms have age restrictions for a reason.

👀 Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, as they may encounter inappropriate content or interactions.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
❌ Incorrect. 

🔑 Social media platforms have age restrictions for a reason. 

👀 Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, as they may encounter inappropriate content or interactions.
Give My Child Structure.comic.intro: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} wants to watch videos on the handphone. Her mother, {F3_MOTHER}, uses this opportunity to teach {F3_DAUGHTER_4} about how to stay safe online:
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.1:
{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Can I use the phone to play games?

{F3_MOTHER}: Sure! But let’s first learn how to be safe when using gadgets. First, the household rule is that you can only use gadgets for 30 minutes each day. I will set a timer that will go off when you have 5 minutes left.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.2:
{F3_MOTHER}: Also, always ask Mummy for permission before using any device. You should also only play games or watch videos that we have approved, okay?

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay, Mummy!
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.3:
{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Can I create my own account for pictures and videos, Mummy? Audrey has an account for herself.

{F3_MOTHER}: Not just yet, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Social media is for older kids. We'll wait until you're a bit older. But we can post pictures on my account together if you want.

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay.
Give My Child Structure.comic.text.4:
{F3_MOTHER}: And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe!

{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Thank you, Mummy!
Give My Child Structure.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱

Here are 4️⃣ tips that can help keep your child safe online: 
1️⃣ LEARN
2️⃣ PROTECT
3️⃣ BUILD HABITS
4️⃣ BUILD TRUST

🔑 Today, we are learning about LEARN and PROTECT. 

✨ The next lesson will cover BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ LEARN the dangers of being online: 

🚩 CONTENT: Your child might come across harmful content, such as violence, hateful speech, pornography, wrong information, or hating women, people with disabilities, or other races, religions, sexualities, or from other countries.
🚩 CONTACT: Adults might pretend to be children and ask for sexual pictures or to meet with your child through an online platform.
🚩 CONDUCT: Sometimes, children or strangers can say or do hurtful things online.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ PROTECT - Keep your child safe online

✅ Talk to your child about which apps and websites are safe and which are not. Discuss why!
✅ Help your child learn how to make strong passwords to protect their devices. 
✅ Tell your child that they should keep personal information private including photos or videos of themselves. What goes online, stays online!
Give My Child Structure.video.message:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱

We are going to learn 4️⃣ ways to keep your child safe online: 
1️⃣ LEARN
2️⃣ PROTECT
3️⃣ BUILD HABITS
4️⃣ BUILD TRUST

Here’s a video about LEARN and PROTECT . 

✨ The next lesson will cover BUILD HABITS and BUILD TRUST.
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.activity:
Home activity! ⭐

Ask your child what they do to stay safe online. 👂 You may find that they are already thinking about online safety. 💡

Praise your child for any efforts they make. Can you talk with Your Child today? 🔔
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! Helping your child stay safe online is important so they can learn and connect with others. Well done for getting involved. They will be safer for it! 🔑
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your child. ⏰ It’s important to talk to our children about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ⭐
Give My Child Structure.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! 🎉 You have learnt how to keep your child safe online. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills in the Keep My Child Safe & Healthy!

Give My Child Structure.introduction.msg_list: This skill continues our learning about keeping our children safe online. 📱
Give My Child Structure.importance.msg_list:
The previous lesson taught you ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT. 🔑

In this skill, we will learn how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST. ✨
Give My Child Structure.quiz.intro:
💡 Often, our children understand more about life online than we do, but that does not mean they know how to keep safe. 

⭐ Let’s test your online safety knowledge.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: If I send a picture to a friend, it will only be visible to them.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct. 

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ What goes online, stays online!
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect.

📱 Even in an app where images are temporary, your friend can capture their screen and save your image. 

🚩 Pictures are always stored online and can be accessed by hackers. 

❗ What goes online, stays online!
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.question: My password is strong because you have to know my home address to guess it.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
✨ That’s correct. 

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

❗ Most passwords are hacked because someone accesses a list of home addresses, birth dates, names or phone numbers. 

🚩 You should never use these details in your password as they are easily guessed.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.3.question: Links sent to me by my family and friends are safe to click on.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
🎈 That’s right! 

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognize the web address, don’t click on it.
Give My Child Structure.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect.

❗ Your family member’s email or phone account could be hacked. 

👀 Always double-check a link before clicking on it to make sure you’re visiting a trusted website. 

🔑 If you don’t recognize the web address, don’t click on it.
Give My Child Structure.tips.intro:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱 

You already learned ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT in the previous lesson.

Today, we are learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.1.text:
3️⃣ BUILD HABITS. Set up safe online habits at home: 

❌📱 Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.
⭐ Only let your child chat online with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.
👀 Before completing forms that ask for personal information, check that the web address begins with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.
📝 For older children, you can help them create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, not include obvious personal information like your name or birthday, and include upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols."
❗ Tell your child not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.
Give My Child Structure.tips.message.2.text:
4️⃣ BUILD TRUST

🌷 Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps your child uses. 
👂 Ask questions - this helps you learn more about your child’s interests!
💙 If you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your child.
✅ Tell your child that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.
Give My Child Structure.video.message:
Keeping Your Child safe online is an important step to help them be part of the digital world. 📱 

You already learned ways to protect your child online with 1️⃣ LEARN and 2️⃣ PROTECT in the previous lesson.

Here’s a 2nd video learning how to 3️⃣ BUILD HABITS and 4️⃣ BUILD TRUST.
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.activity:
Here are some steps you can take to keep your child safe online today:

 📝 Have a conversation with your child about how they can use the internet and devices in a safe way. 

🔴 Talk about which sites or apps might be unsafe. Why?

😃 Praise your child for how good they are at using the web!

Can you and your child complete this task today? 🔔
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! Helping your child stay safe online is important so they can learn and connect with others. Well done for getting involved. They will be safer for it! 🔑
Give My Child Structure.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Put some time aside this week to do this activity with your child. ⏰ It’s important to talk to our children about how to stay safe online so they can use the digital world to learn more and connect with others. You can do this! ⭐
Give My Child Structure.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing! 🎉 You have learnt how to keep your child safe online. You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills in Keep My Child Safe and Healthy!

Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.introduction.msg_list:
Today we are going to learn about what to do when our children misbehave. 🚩 

It is normal for children to misbehave sometimes when they are tired, scared, hungry, learning independence, wanting something, or avoiding a task. 😒😔😣
;
One thing we can do is stop it before it starts.We call this Redirecting Behaviours.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.importance.msg_list:
Redirecting Behaviours can help focus Your Child’s attention from negative to positive behaviours. 😣➡️😃

For example, when Your Child begins to whine, you can redirect their attention towards something positive like helping out with an activity. 🌱🎨
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: You can use redirect at any time, even when your child is already behaving badly like having a tantrum.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 You are right! 

➡️ Redirecting your child’s behaviour only works either before the behaviour begins or at the beginning of the behaviour (before it gets worse).

🙂 We will learn about what we can do if your child is already behaving badly in the next 2 modules.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ Incorrect. 

➡️ Redirecting your child’s behaviour only works either before the behaviour begins or at the beginning of the behaviour (before it gets worse).

🙂 We will learn about what we can do if your child is already behaving badly in the next 2 modules.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.1: {F2_GRANDFATHER} is working in the garden while his granddaughter, {F2_DAUGHTER_8} and grandson, {F2_SON_3} are playing with a ball.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.2:
{F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Give it back to me!

{F2_SON_3}: But I want it!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.3: {F2_GRANDFATHER}: {F2_DAUGHTER_8} and {F2_SON_3} come and help me plant these vegetables together.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.4: {F2_GRANDFATHER}: Thank you for coming to help me. We are going to grow some vegetables together.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.intro: 4️⃣ There are four steps to redirecting behaviour: BE CALM, QUICK, CLEAR, and POSITIVE.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE CALM

✅ Take a few breaths before asking Your Child to do something else.
✅ Speak with a calm voice.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ BE QUICK

⏰ Ask Your Child to do something else, distract them, before the behaviour begins or gets worse.
💡 This is much easier than using consequences after they do something!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ BE CLEAR

✅ Rather than saying what you DON’T like or want, tell Your Child what you DO want them to do.
For example, say:
👂 “Please speak more softly.”
🍚 “Remember to wash your hands after eating.”
This way, it is easier for them to follow! ⭐
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ BE POSITIVE

💚 Use positive words. Say “Come and help me plant these vegetables,” instead of saying, “Stop fighting.”.
⭐ Praise Your Child when they behave well!
💙 It will also help them know what you expect from them!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.video.message: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ tips for redirecting your child's behaviour.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn 4️⃣ tips for redirecting your child's behaviour.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.activity:
Home Activity! Share these four steps with another member of your family. Sharing these skills will be great for everyone’s well being. ➡️

Can you share these tips today?
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! Sometimes it takes time to share a new parenting skill. You can always review this skill in the Main Menu! 📝
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.congratulations.msg_list:
Well done! 🎉 You have learnt how to redirect the behaviour of Your Child!
You have completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage My Child’s Behaviour. 🏆

Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about what to do when children are seeking attention with demanding and negative behaviours. 🚩
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.importance.msg_list:
Children need attention from very early in their lives. 💛 

Did you know that attention is a powerful reward for most children, particularly when they are young? 🎁 

It’s a great way to help them feel good about themselves. They are more likely to do as they are asked! 🔄
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: You should give your child what they want when they are whining about something or having a tantrum.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

Giving your child attention when they are whining or having a tantrum will only make it worse.

Your child will learn that they get rewarded with attention (even negative attention) when they behave that way.

Instead, try to give your child plenty of positive attention when they behave positively (like accepting when you say they cannot have something they want).
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

Giving your child attention when they are whining or having a tantrum will only make it worse.

Your child will learn that they get rewarded with attention (even negative attention) when they behave that way.

Instead, try to give your child plenty of positive attention when they behave positively (like accepting when you say they cannot have something they want).
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.2.question: Here is another True/False question: It is okay to give into your child if they continue to whine or have a tantrum.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.2.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

If you give in to your child, they will learn that they get their way only when they persist or make their behaviour even worse.

Try to stay calm and ignore your child’s behaviour even though it is very difficult.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.2.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

If you give in to your child, they will learn that they get their way only when they persist or make their behaviour even worse.

Try to stay calm and ignore your child’s behaviour even though it is very difficult.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.3.question: Last one! True or False: You should ignore your child even after they stop their demanding behaviour. It is the only way for them to learn their lesson.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.3.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

💚 After showing demanding behaviour, your child will need love and care. It was difficult for them too. Take deep breaths and praise them for changing to a more positive behaviour. 

❗ Ignoring your child is never a good idea! You can ignore negative behaviour, but never your child.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.3.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

💚 After showing demanding behaviour, your child will need love and care. It was difficult for them too. Take deep breaths and praise them for changing to a more positive behaviour. 

❗ Ignoring your child is never a good idea! You can ignore negative behaviour, but never your child.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.intro: Dinner time isn’t going the way that {F3_DAUGHTER_4} wants. Let’s see how her mother, {F3_MOTHER}, handles her behaviour:
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.1:
{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: I want another sweet drink.

{F3_MOTHER}: The household rule is that you can only have one glass of sweet drink during dinner, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.2:
{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: But I WANT it! Give me!

{F3_MOTHER}: {F3_SON_7}, you are eating your dinner so nicely.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.3:
{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Waaaaaa! Waaaaaa! WAAAAAA!

{F3_MOTHER}: {F3_SON_7}, can you please take the pudding from the counter?
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.4:
{F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Waaaaaa! Waaaaaa! WAAAAAA!

{F3_MOTHER}: Take a deep breath. I can do this…
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.5: {F3_MOTHER}: It is nice to see you sitting quietly, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Here, have some delicious pudding.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.intro: 5️⃣ There are five steps to reduce negative, attention-seeking and demanding behaviour, such as whining or throwing tantrums.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ REDIRECT

🎨 Be calm, quick, clear, and positive when redirecting their attention to a positive behaviour or activity. 
🌷 Praise them for this positive behaviour!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ KNOW WHAT TO IGNORE

💡 Whining, demanding, showing off, tantrums, and other negative attention-seeking behaviours can be ignored. There are no bad children, only difficult behaviours!
🚩 If we respond to negative behaviours, our children learn that this behaviour will get them attention, so they will do it again. They might also learn that if they increase their demand, they will get their way.
❗ Some behaviours that should NOT be ignored are: hitting siblings, coming home late, or doing something dangerous. We will learn about how to manage these behaviours in the next module.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ IGNORE THE BEHAVIOUR, NOT YOUR CHILD

🌱 When you ignore your child's behaviour (but not your child!), your child learns that the demanding behaviour will not work.
💡 Ignoring behaviour means looking away and not talking or responding to them until they behave a different way. You should still be aware of what your child is doing.
⏰ This takes time and patience. Often your child will behave worse to get the attention. Take a pause, stay calm, and keep ignoring the behaviour.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ PRAISE THE POSITIVE 

☀️ Praise your child’s next positive behaviour.
🎈 Once your child has calmed down after showing demanding behaviour, they will need lots of love and attention on positive behaviour.
🧸 You can talk later or the next day about the demanding behaviour. For now, involve your child in a positive activity.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.5.text:
5️⃣ BE CONSISTENT 

⭐ Even if your child behaves worse to get attention, it is important to continue ignoring the behaviour. Over time, your child will learn that this demanding behaviour does not work.
💚 Spend lots of positive time with your child - especially right after a demanding behaviour. Positive one-on-one time is super important!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.video.message: ▶️ Press play to learn the 5️⃣ five steps to reduce your child's negative behaviour.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn the 5️⃣ five steps to reduce your child's negative behaviour.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.activity:
Home activity! ⭐ Find one positive thing Your Child does today and praise them for it. If your child shows any negative, attention-seeking behaviour, redirect and if they continue, try ignoring it. Remember to ignore the behaviour, not your child! 

Can you find something to praise your child for today? ⏰
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 Praising our children means they are more likely to repeat this positive behaviour. Ignoring demanding behaviour can be hard, but if you are patient and give it time, it really works.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! 💙 Ignoring demanding behaviour can be hard. Praising our children for positive behaviour means they are more likely to repeat it! You can always review what you learnt today in the Main Menu and build your confidence. You’ve got this!

Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.introduction.msg_list: This skill is about how we can keep control and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments. 💚
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.importance.msg_list:
🌷 We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us angry. This is a normal part of life! 

💡 It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
🎉 That’s correct! 

💛 It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

🌱 Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.

➡️ You can also redirect or ignore negative behaviour without ignoring your child when they are making you angry.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

💛 It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything. 

🌱 Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.

➡️ You can also redirect or ignore negative behaviour without ignoring your child when they are making you angry.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.intro: {F1_MOTHER} has her hands full and having two of her children fighting over a phone isn’t helping. Let’s see how she’s managing her anger:
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.1:
{F1_SON_5}: Give it to me! 
{F1_DAUGHTER_6}: I had it first!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.3: {F1_MOTHER}: {F1_SON_5} and {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, come and help me prepare dinner. We are making your favourite dish!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.4: {F1_MOTHER}: Thank you for helping me get these veggies clean for our dinner tonight!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.intro:
Controlling your actions in anger is not easy. 😔

3️⃣ Practising these three steps will help you interact with your child in a more useful way.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ ADDRESS THE SOURCE

🧸 Prevent anger in the first place by making sure to sleep or rest when tired.
🍞 Have something to eat when you are hungry.
💚 Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ TAKE A PAUSE

🌷 Slowly breathe in and out 5 times before you speak or move. 
☀️ Go somewhere else for 10 minutes to regain control of your emotions. A safe outdoor space is a good option!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ LOOK AFTER YOURSELF

☕ Talk to friends, family, and other support networks everyday. We all need to connect. 💙
❗ If you have weapons or things that can be used to hurt others, lock them up or take them out of your home.
🚗 It’s OK to have your children stay somewhere safe while you recover.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.video.message:
Controlling your actions in anger is not easy. 😔

▶️ Press play to learn the 3️⃣ three steps to help you interact with your child in a more useful way.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn the 3️⃣ three steps to help you interact with your child in a more useful way.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐ If you start feeling angry today, breathe in and out slowly 5 times before you do anything and notice how you feel. Can you do this today? ⏰
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.positive_msg: Great! 💙 Be proud of yourself when you manage to control your anger!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.negative_msg: That's OK! If you don't have time today, practise controlling any anger you feel tomorrow. You can practise this skill any time you start feeling angry. You are a super parent! 😃

Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.introduction.msg_list: Today you will learn what you can do when your child refuses to follow an instruction, forgets a family rule, or behaves in an aggressive or dangerous way… 😔
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.importance.msg_list:
Children are still learning which actions are appropriate in different situations and which aren’t. 👀

Consequences teach our children that their actions affect themselves and others. ❗
;
It is important for our children to learn this as they grow. 🌱 

Giving clear consequences teaches children responsibility for their actions more than hitting or shouting does. 💙
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: I can choose any consequence to give my child.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct!

💡 It is easier for your child to follow the rule if the consequence is connected to the rule. 

📺 For example, if Your Child doesn’t want to stop watchingT.V., Your Child won’t get to watch T.V. tomorrow.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

💡 It is easier for your child to follow the rule if the consequence is connected to the rule. 

📺 For example, if Your Child doesn’t want to stop watching T.V., Your Child won’t get to watch T.V. tomorrow.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.intro: It’s time to clean up from dinner and {F1_DAUGHTER_2} would rather play. Watch how her Ayah, {F1_FATHER}, responds:
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.1: {F1_FATHER}: You are playing so nice and quiet, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}. In 5 minutes, it will be time to clean up your toys.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.2:
{F1_FATHER}: It’s time to put away your toys.

{F1_DAUGHTER_2}: No.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.3:
{F1_FATHER}: Either you put away the toys now, or you won’t be able to play with your toys after dinner..

{F1_DAUGHTER_2}: No Ayah, I don’t want to!
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.4: {F1_FATHER}: Because you did not listen, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}, you cannot play with your toys after dinner. Now come wash hands.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.comic.text.5: {F1_FATHER}: Thank you for washing your hands, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.intro: 4️⃣ Here are four simple steps for using consequences when your child behaves badly:
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ BE CALM

❗ Shouting at our children only makes things worse. It also teaches them that it is okay to treat others like this when they are upset.
🌷 Take some deep breaths or walk away if you need to.
💚 Then, respond in a calm, clear way.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ BE FAIR

💡 Before giving a consequence, give your child the option to behave and time to do as you asked.
🔄 Give a consequence connected to the behaviour. For example, if they do not clean up their toys, they cannot play with them the next day.
🔑 Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, tell them they can’t play with their toys **today**, rather than for the whole week.
👀 Notice if your child is experiencing a natural consequence for their action already. If so, you might not need to give them one.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ BE CONSISTENT

➡️ It is important to follow through with consequences for the rules you have set every time they do not follow them.
⭐ This helps your child to know what to expect, and makes it more likely that they will follow the rule.
🎈 Talk about consequences for breaking household rules when you set them so that Your Child knows them and stick to them.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ BE POSITIVE

🏆 Praise your child every time they do actions you want to see more of. This makes them more likely to repeat this behaviour!
🎉 Using consequences can be hard at first, but will get easier with practice!
✨ Consequences help our children learn that their actions affect others - and to think before they act.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.video.message: ▶️ Press play to learn the 4️⃣ four steps to using consequences with your child.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.audio.message: ▶️ Press play to learn the 4️⃣ four steps to using consequences with your child.
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.activity:
Your Home Activity today is to praise Your Child for one thing you’d like them to keep doing. If Your Child refuses to follow instructions, you can use a fair consequence. Remember to give your child a choice to follow the instruction before giving the consequence and respond in a calm way.

Can you praise Your Child for their positive behaviour today?
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.positive_msg:
Well done! 🎉 Praising Your Child for their actions makes them more likely to repeat this positive behaviour. This way, you are less likely to need to set consequences in the first place! A fair consequence will help Your Child learn that their actions impact themselves and others. It also teaches them about responsibility and respect! 😃

If Your Child continues to misbehave, tell them how you feel in a calm way and give them a fair consequence for their behaviour. ⭐
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.home_activity.negative_msg:
Managing your child’s behaviour is hard! 😣 

Hitting and yelling does not cause lasting change - and can damage your relationship with Your Child over time. ❗ 

Next time Your Child behaves well, praise them for it, even if it’s something small! This way, you are less likely to need to give them consequences in the first place. 

If Your Child continues to misbehave, tell them how you feel in a calm way and give them a fair consequence for their behaviour. You might see it change the way they behave in the future. ⭐
Supporting Positive Child Behaviour.congratulations.msg_list: Amazing work! 🎉 You have learnt how to use fair consequences! You have now completed @(fields.c_n_mod_compl +1) out of @fields.c_n_mod skills towards your goal, Manage my Child’s Behaviour.

Build a Family Budget and Save Money.introduction.msg_list:
In this goal, we are learning about the four steps to building a family budget. 💰

1️⃣ The first step is identifying needs and wants. 🍞🚗📱
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.importance.msg_list:
Managing how money is spent is important to ensure that parents are able to provide for our children. 💛

When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. 😒😔😣
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.intro: 3️⃣ Let's learn three steps to start your family budget!
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ IDENTIFY NEEDS

📝 With your family, make a list of things that you cannot live without. Things that are important for your family to survive. 
⭐ For example food 🍚, medicine, or laundry detergent.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ IDENTIFY WANTS

🎁 Make a list of things that you or others want. These are things that would be nice to have but not essential. 
For example the latest version of a smartphone 📱, new toy 🧸, or a new car 🚗.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ TALK

👀 People often see things in different ways. 
📝 You may find that your family members see one thing as a NEED while you see it as a WANT. 
💰 Talk with your family about why you feel differently, this will help you to understand each other and can make decisions together about what to spend money on.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.video.message: ▶️ Press play and learn 3️⃣ three steps to start your family budget!
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.audio.message: Here’s an audio message about starting to build a family budget.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ⭐ Discuss your wants and needs with your family. Do you have time to do it today?
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! Discussing Needs and Wants is very important for creating a successful budget plan. 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg:
That’s OK. The best place to start is by thinking about your own wants and needs before speaking with other members of your family. 📝

Once you feel comfortable, you can take the next step and complete step two of setting a family budget. ✨ Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu.💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the first step to family budgeting! 🎉 You are one step closer to achieving the badge for family budgeting.

Build a Family Budget and Save Money.introduction.msg_list:
In this goal, we are learning about the four steps to building a family budget. 💰

2️⃣ Today, we are learning about step 2: talking about monthly expenses.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.importance.msg_list:
🔑 Knowing what your family’s monthly expenses are can be helpful for everyone in your family. 

💡 It can help them understand why money is being spent on some things and not on others.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.1.text: 📝 Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.2.text: 🎨 Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.3.text: 📝 Write next to each picture how much each thing costs.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.4.text: 💰 Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.5.text: Take a picture of the paper or save it for Step 3! ⭐
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.video.message: ▶️Press play to learn step 2 of building a family budget.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.audio.message: ▶️Press play to learn step 2 of building a family budget.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home activity! ⭐ It’s time to add up your monthly expenses. Do you have time to do it today?
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! Involving your family will help them learn how to make a budget and understand how money is spent! 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Try to make some time to do this soon. You can do this! 🌷 Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu. 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the second step to family budgeting! 🎉 You are one step closer to achieving the badge for family budgeting.

Build a Family Budget and Save Money.introduction.msg_list:
In this goal, we are learning about the four steps to building a family budget. 💰

3️⃣ Today, we are reviewing step 3: making a monthly budget.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.importance.msg_list: Balancing the money you earn with the money you need to spend is an important step in making a monthly budget. 📝
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.intro: Here is how you can build a monthly budget:
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.1.text: 🎨 Take the piece of paper from the monthly expenses activity that shows all the things you spend money on during a month.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.2.text: 💰 Add up all the money your family has available each month. This can be from a job, welfare grants, or even money sent to the family by other relatives.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.3.text: 📱🚲 Decide which of the expenses are things that you NEED and which are things that you WANT. 📺🍞🚗
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.4.text: ⭐ Draw a star next to everything that you NEED. Add up all the things that have a star next to it.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.5.text:
💡 Is the amount more or less than your monthly budget? 

⬆️ If it is less, you can add some things that you WANT. 

⬇️ If it is more, then you may want to discuss with your child which things are really NEEDS. 

😔 You may need to make difficult choices between different things. 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.video.message: ▶️Press play to learn step 3 of building a family budget.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.audio.message: ▶️Press play to learn step 3 of building a family budget.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ⭐ It’s time to get out your paper and build your monthly budget. Do you have time to do it today?
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.positive_msg: That’s great! Consider involving your family: it’s a great skill for everyone to learn. 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Try to do it this week. Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu. 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the third step to family budgeting. 🎉 You are one step closer to achieving the badge for family budgeting. ⭐

Build a Family Budget and Save Money.introduction.msg_list:
Congratulations! You have reached the final step to family budgeting. 💰

4️⃣ Today, we are reviewing the final step: make a saving plan. You should be very proud of your dedication!
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.importance.msg_list:
🌷 Making a saving plan can help you prepare for crises while also having funds for your child’s education and other things that you may need in the future. 

✨ Even a small amount each month can make a big difference over time.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.quiz.content.1.question: True or False: It’s OK to think about saving in the future if I don’t have enough now.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.quiz.content.1.feedback_correct:
⭐ That’s correct! 

It may seem hard 😔 but it’s good to save some money, even if it’s not much, for an emergency or big family expenditure in the future. You are a super parent! 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.quiz.content.1.feedback_incorrect:
❌ That’s incorrect. 

It may seem hard 😔 but it’s good to save some money, even if it’s not much, for an emergency or big family expenditure in the future. You are a super parent! 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.comic.intro: {F3_MOTHER} has big hopes for her children’s futures and she is making a plan:
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.comic.text.1: "I want the best future for my children, but I don’t know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. I should save, but that feels impossible!"
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.comic.text.2: "My goal is to make sure my children reach their dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?"
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.comic.text.3: "I know - let’s start with a plan! First, let me make a budget – a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time – I will even join a savings and loans group."
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.comic.text.4: "I should also speak with my children to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but don’t need."
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.comic.text.5: In the future: "Look, we reached our dreams! I didn’t borrow any money from friends or loan sharks. By saving a tiny bit each week, I managed to pay for {F3_DAUGHTER_4}’s college fees and save some money for {F3_SON_7}’s university. I am so proud of this.”
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.intro: 5️⃣ Here are five tips on how to make a savings plan for you and your child:
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.1.text:
1️⃣ WHY SAVE

Decide why you want to save money. These could include:
😔Preparing for emergencies
🎁 Buying something nice for you or your child or do something fun as a family
📖 Planning for future big expenses like improvements on your home or for your child’s education
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.2.text:
2️⃣ HOW TO SAVE

🚩 Set a target amount that you want to save. 
💰 Look at your monthly budget and decide how much you can save each week and each month.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.3.text:
3️⃣ WHERE TO SAVE

Consider the different ways to keep money safe for future use. These could include:
🔑 Saving at a bank
💚 Keeping money safe at home
💰 Keeping money in a savings and loan group
🌷 Buying livestock like goats or cattle 
Decide which way of saving money would work best for the family.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.4.text:
4️⃣ EMERGENCY FUNDS

❗ If you can try and save even a tiny amount for the future or for an emergency. This can make a big difference over time.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.tips.message.5.text:
5️⃣ GET SUPPORT

🌱 Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need. 
💛 Think about whether there are places in your community that provide support.
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.video.message: ▶️Press play to learn 5 tips for making a savings plan for you and your child:
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.audio.message: ▶️Press play to learn 5 tips for making a savings plan for you and your child:
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.activity: Home Activity! ⭐ It’s time to create your savings plan. Do you have time to do it today?
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.home_activity.negative_msg: That’s OK. Try to do it this week. Remember you can refer back to this content in the Main Menu. 💚
Build a Family Budget and Save Money.congratulations.msg_list: Well done, you have completed the final step in making a family budget and have earned yourself the family budgeting trophy! Congratulations! ⭐
